description: Construction of a three-storey building to provide six self-contained flats (following demolition of existing garage); and associated amenity, cycle storage, landscaped, vehicle parking, and waste storage spaces
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (As Amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the document/drawing titles: Tree Impact Plan (August 2020); B01 Rev. B; L01; L01 Rev. B; A101; A102; A103; and A104 Rev. B.

REASON: For avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning. | Prior to commencement of development, details of the materials to be used for the external surfaces and finishing of all buildings and structures of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. This condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters that have been given in this application. Development shall be carried out only in accordance with the approved details and, thereafter, permanently retained and maintained.

REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the neighbouring buildings and surrounding area in accordance with Section 12 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2019) and policies D3 and D4 of the Publication London Plan (2020); 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016); 1.1 and 1.2 of the Local Development Framework (Core) Strategy (2012); and 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013). | A minimum of twelve (12) secured cycle parking spaces shall be provided as shown in dwg. A104 Rev. B of the Approved Plans and in accordance with adopted standards of the Publication London Plan (2020) and London Plan (2016). Such provision shall be brought into use prior to first occupation and retained permanently.

REASON: To provide adequate facilities for cyclists and increase the use of active and sustainable modes of transport, in accordance with policies T1, T2, T4, and T5 of Publication London Plan (2020); and 6.1, 6.9 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2016). | A maximum of one (1) off-street vehicle parking space shall be provided with this space being designed for disabled users and provided with an active Electric Vehicle Charging Point (EVCP) in accordance with adopted standards of the Publication London Plan (2020) and London Plan (2016) and as shown in dwg. A104 Rev. B of the Approved Plans. Such provision shall be brought into use prior to first occupation of the development and retained permanently.

REASON: To provide adequate parking facilities for motorists without prejudicing strategies adopted to increase the use of sustainable modes of transport, in accordance with policies T1, T2, T6 and T6.1 of the Publication London Plan (2020); 6.1 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2016); and 6.13 of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013). | A minimum of one (1) 1,100.0 litre bin dedicated to recycling, one (1) 1,100.0 litre bin dedicated to recycling, and six (6) 23.0 litre bins dedicated to food waste shall be provided in within the curtilage of the property in accordance with dwg. A104 Rev. B of the Approved Plans and the adopted standards of the Publication London Plan (2020) and London Plan (2016. Such provision shall be brought into use prior to first occupation and retained permanently.

REASON: In the interests of safeguarding public health, reducing and managing waste generated by the development, and keeping local highways clear of visual blight and impediments to movement in accordance with the Ealing Council's Waste Management Guidelines for Architects and Developers, as well as, policies D4, D6, D8, SI7, T1, T2, T4 and T5 of the Publication London Plan (2020); 5.17, 6.3, 6.9, 6.10, and 6.11 of the London Plan (2016); 1.1 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012); and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013). | Prior to commencement of construction and demolition works, a detailed Construction Method Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The plan must detail the:
-	Methods for and phasing of all construction and demolition;
-	Site security;
-	Consolidated or re-timed trips;
-	On-site construction worker parking;
-	Secure, off-street loading and drop-off facilities;
-	Compliance with the Non-Road Mobile Machinery Low Emissions Zone;
-	Use of Transport for London's Freight Operator Recognition Scheme (FORS) or similar;
-	Site access for construction traffic and contractor staff parking and associated signage;
-	Anticipated number, frequency and size of construction vehicles entering/exiting the site;
-	Locations for the contractors' offices and storage of building materials and construction debris;
-	Delivery times and booking system (staggered to avoid morning and afternoon school run peak periods);
-	Vehicle manoeuvring and turning, including swept path diagrams to demonstrate how vehicles will access the site and be able to turn into and emerge from the site in forward gear;

-	Procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents including the name, telephone number and address of a responsible person to whom enquiries / complaints should be directed. These contact details shall also be displayed at regular intervals around the site compound; and

-	Control measures for dust, noise, vibration, lighting, delivery locations, restriction of hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary to 08:00-18:00hrs Mondays to Fridays and 08:00-13:00 hrs on Saturdays - in accordance with the GLA's SPG for The Control of Dust and Emissions During Construction and Demolition (2014), ILP's Guidance Notes 1 for the Reduction of Obtrusive Light (2020), BS 5228-1:2009+A1:2014, and BS 5228-2:2009+A1:2014 - and the advance notification to neighbours and other interested parties of proposed works.
The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the approved plan for the duration of the works.

REASON: To protect the amenity of local residents and ensure adequate highway and site safety in accordance with policies D11, D14, SI1, S12, T1, T2, T4 and T5 of the Publication London Plan (2020); 5.3, 6.3, 7.13, 7.14 and 7.15  of the London Plan (2016); 1.1(e)(j) and 2.1(c) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012); 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013); the Greater London Authority Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition (2006); and BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise. | The sound insulation of the building envelope (incl. glazing specifications and external amenity areas) shall be provided in accordance with the Local Planning Authority's standards as stated in Ealing's Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 and achieve compliance with the acoustic criteria specified in BS8233:2014. If compliance requires the windows to be closed, then acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation and cooling shall be installed as necessary with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building and low self-noise.  The sound insulation and necessary measures must be provided/implemented prior to the first occupation of the development and, thereafter, permanently retained and maintained.

REASON: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise from aircraft noise generated within the worst mode aircraft one-day noise contour predicted for 2016 (57/60 dB) in accordance with policies D6 and D14 of the Publication London Plan (2020); 7.15 of the London Plan (2016); and 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013). | The sound insulation of the building envelope (incl. glazing specifications and external amenity areas) shall be provided in accordance with the Local Planning Authority's standards as stated in Ealing's Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 and achieve compliance with the acoustic criteria specified in BS8233:2014. If compliance requires the windows to be closed, then acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation and cooling shall be installed as necessary with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building and low self-noise.  The sound insulation and necessary measures must be provided/implemented prior to the first occupation of the development and, thereafter, permanently retained and maintained.

REASON: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise from commercial and transport sources, in accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework (2019) and policies D6 and D14 of the Publication London Plan (2020); 7.15 of the London Plan (2016); and 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013). | The individual and combined external noise level emitted from plant, machinery or equipment at the development site shall be lower than the lowest existing background noise level by at least 10dBA as measured at or calculated to the nearest and most affected noise sensitive premises. The assessment shall be completed in accordance with BS4142:2014 (e.g. ensuring all machinery operating together at maximum capacity).

REASON: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development and surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from mechanical installations/equipment, in accordance with policies D6 and D14 of the Publication London Plan (2020); 7.15 of the London Plan (2016); and 7A of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013). | Prior to their first use, all machinery / plant / equipment / extraction / ventilation systems and ducting for the development hereby approved shall be mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and all fan motors shall be vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced and maintained as such of the life of the development.

REASON: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the approved development and surrounding premises is not adversely affected by vibration noise, in accordance with Council's SPG 10 - Noise and Vibration, as well as, policies D6 and D14 of the Publication London Plan (2020); 7.15 of the London Plan (2016); and 7A of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013). | Prior to commencement of the development hereby approved, details of the installation plan for a filtered fresh air ventilation system capable of mitigating elevated concentrations of nitrogen oxides and particulate matter in the external air shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details shall include the arrangements for continuously maintaining the operational efficiency of the system. The approved ventilation system must be installed prior to the first occupation of the development and, thereafter, maintained/retained for the life of the development.

REASON: In the interest of protecting the health of future occupants of the development in accordance with policies GG3, D6 and SI1 of the Publication London Plan (2020); and 3.2, 3.5 and 7.14 of the London Plan (2016). | Prior to commencement of any operations in connection with the development hereby approved (incl. initial site clearance), details of a suitable scheme (i.e. Arboricultural Method Statement) for the protection of existing trees and hedgerows and an implementation plan for the scheme shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

All protection measures included in the scheme must fully detail each phase of the development process taking into account demolition/site clearance works, all construction works, and hard and soft landscaping works.  The details of the scheme must include the following:
-	Level changes;
-	Landscaping proposals;
-	Soil assessments/surveys;
-	The timing and phasing of all works;
-	Access arrangements and car parking;
-	Details of the arboricultural supervision schedule;
-	Site-specific demolition and hard surface removal specifications;
-	Site-specific construction specifications (e.g. in connection with foundations, bridging, water features, surfacing);
-	Soil remediation plans where unauthorised access has damaged root protection areas in the construction exclusion zones;

-	A fully survey of all trees on site and those within influencing distance on adjacent sites completed in accordance with the most recent revision of BS5837. All trees must be plotted on a site plan that clearly and accurately depicts trunk locations, root protection areas and canopy spreads. Unless otherwise agreed by the Local Planning Authority, the site plan must be of a minimum scale of 1:200;
-	A plan detailing all trees and hedgerows planned for retention and removal. Unless otherwise agreed by the Local Planning Authority, the plan must be of a minimum scale of 1:200;

-	A schedule of tree works for all trees to be retained that specifies pruning and other remedial or preventative work, whether for physiological, hazard abatement, aesthetic or operational reasons.  All tree works shall be carried out in accordance with BS 3998; and

-	A tree protection plan detailing all methods of protection including but not limited to locations of construction exclusion zones, root protection areas, fit for purpose fencing and ground protection, service routes, works access space, material/machinery/waste storage, and permanent and temporary hard surfaces. The plan must be completed in accordance with the most recent revision of BS5837.

All tree protection methods detailed in the approved Arboricultural Method Statement shall not be moved or removed, temporarily or otherwise, until all works (incl. external works) have been completed and all equipment, machinery and surplus materials have been removed from the  site, unless the prior approval of the Local Planning Authority has first been sought and obtained.

REASON: To safeguard existing trees in the interests of protecting the visual amenity of the local area and retaining existing urban greening in accordance with Ealing's SPG 9 - Trees and Development Guidelines, as well as, policies D4, G5, G7, SI1 and SI2 of the Publication London Plan (2020); 3.5, 5.10, 7.4, 7.5, 7.14 and 7.21 of the London Plan (2016); and 5.10, 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013). | Prior to commencement of development (incl. ground works and site clearance), a Tree Monitoring Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The plan must include:
-	Confirmation of who shall be the lead arboriculturalist for the development;
-	Confirmation of the Site Manager and key personnel including their key responsibilities and contact details;

-	Details of induction procedures for all personnel in relation to arboricultural matters; A detailed timetable of events for arboricultural supervision concerning all tree protection measures within the approved Tree Protection Plan including: prestart meeting with an Ealing Council Tree Officer, initial implementation/installation of the tree protection measures, approved incursions in to construction exclusion zones, and final removal of the tree protection measures; and
-	Procedures for dealing with non-approved incursions into the construction exclusion zones as detailed in the approved Arboricultural Method Statement.
The development shall be carried out in strict accordance with the approved plan for the duration of the works.

REASON: To safeguard existing trees in the interests of protecting the visual amenity of the local area and retaining existing urban greening in accordance with Ealing's SPG 9 - Trees and Development Guidelines, as well as, policies D4, G5, G7, SI1 and SI2 of the Publication London Plan (2020); 3.5, 5.10, 7.4, 7.5, 7.14 and 7.21 of the London Plan (2016); and 5.10, 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013). | Within three (3) month of the first occupation of the development hereby approved, Tree Monitoring Report shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The report must contain:
-	Results of each site visit by the lead arboriculturist (incl. site photos); and
-	An assessment of the retained and planted trees including any necessary remedial action taken as a result of damage incurred during construction.

REASON: To safeguard existing trees in the interests of protecting the visual amenity of the local area and retaining existing urban greening in accordance with Ealing's SPG 9 - Trees and Development Guidelines, as well as, policies D4, G5, G7, SI1 and SI2 of the Publication London Plan (2020); 3.5, 5.10, 7.4, 7.5, 7.14 and 7.21 of the London Plan (2016); and 5.10, 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013). | Prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved, a Tree Planting and Tree Pits Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The plan must include the following comprehensive details of all trees to be planted:
-	Full planting specifications (i.e. tree size, species, the number of trees, and any changes from the tree planting scheme illustrated on the plans listed in Condition 2);
-	Location of all proposed species; and
-	Comprehensive details of ground/tree pit preparation including:
o	Plans detailing adequate soil volume provision to allow the tree to grow to maturity;
o	Engineering solutions to demonstrate the tree will not interfere with structures (e.g. root barriers/deflectors) in the future;
o	Staking/tying method(s); and
o	Five-year post planting maintenance and inspection schedule.

The approved plan must be fully implemented in the nearest planting season (1st October to 28th February inclusive) and maintained for the life of the development. The quality of all approved tree planting should be carried out to the levels detailed in British Standard 8545, Trees: from nursery to independence in the landscape - Recommendations.

Any trees which die, are removed, uprooted, significantly damaged, become diseased or malformed within five years from the completion of planting, must be replaced during the nearest planting season (1st October to 31st March inclusive) with a tree/s of the same size, species and quality as previously approved.

REASON: To ensure an acceptable provision of urban greening in the interests of enhancing the visual amenity of the local area and improving air quality in accordance with Ealing's SPG 9 - Trees and Development Guidelines, as well as, policies D4, G5, G7, SI1 and SI2 of the Publication London Plan (2020); 3.5, 5.10, 7.4, 7.5, 7.14 and 7.21 of the London Plan (2016); and 5.10, 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013). | The existing trees, shrubs and hedges on-site to be retained as illustrated in the drawings listed in Condition 2 shall not be felled, uprooted, wilfully damaged/destroyed, cut back in any way, or removed without prior written consent from the Local Planning Authority.

Any shrubs or hedges removed without consent, dying or being severely damaged, or becoming seriously diseased within five (5) years from the completion of the development hereby approved shall be replaced with shrubs or hedge plants, or similar species capable of achieving a comparable size, unless the Local Planning Authority gives written consent to any variation.

Any trees removed without consent, dying or being severely damaged, or becoming seriously diseased within five (5) years from the completion of the development hereby approved shall be replaced in accordance with trees, shrubs or hedge plants of similar size and species unless the Local Planning Authority gives written consent to any variation.

REASON: To safeguard existing trees in the interests of protecting the visual amenity of the local area and retaining existing urban greening in accordance with Ealing's SPG 9 - Trees and Development Guidelines, as well as, policies D4, G5, G7, SI1 and SI2 of the Publication London Plan (2020); 3.5, 5.10, 7.4, 7.5, 7.14 and 7.21 of the London Plan (2016); and 5.10, 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013). | Prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved, works to provide the hard and soft landscaping shown on the approved plans listed in Condition 2 shall be carried out in full, to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority, and maintained permanently. Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season and maintained permanently.

REASON: In the interests of protecting the visual amenity of the local area, ensuring suitable amenity spaces are provided for future occupants, and providing sustainable urban drainage in accordance with policies D1, D4, D6, G5, G7, SI12 and SI13 of the Publication London Plan (2020); 3.5, 5.10, 5.12, 5.13, 7.4, 7.5, 7.6, and 7.21 of the London Plan (2016); and 5.10, 7A, 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013). | Prior to the commencement of development, a sustainable drainage strategy shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The strategy shall include a detailed drainage design (incl. drawings and supporting calculations) and maintenance plan (incl. maintenance tasks for all drainage components) that demonstrate the reduction of flood risk (betterment of exiting drainage) at the site through sustainable drainage mitigation techniques. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and permanently retained and maintained.

REASON: To reduce surface water run-off and the risk of the flooding of the application property, neighbouring properties, and local area in accordance with policies SI12 and SI13 of the Publication London Plan (2020); 5.12 and 5.13 of the London Plan (2016); 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012); and 5.12 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | External artificial lighting at the development shall not exceed lux levels of vertical illumination at neighbouring premises that are recommended by the Institution of Lighting Professionals in the 'Guidance Notes for The Reduction of Light Pollution 2011'. Lighting should be minimised, and glare and sky glow should be prevented by correctly using, locating, aiming and shielding luminaires, in accordance with the Guidance Notes.

REASON: To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of nearby residential properties and increase security for users of the site in accordance with policies D4, D6, D8, D11 and SD6 of the Publication London Plan (2020); 7.3 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2016; 1.1 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2026 (2012); 7A and 7.3 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
